plants.name: Prunus serrulata
plants.description: A deciduous tree famous for its stunning springtime display of pale pink to white flowers that herald the arrival of spring in Japan and parts of temperate climates worldwide.
plants.funFact: Japanese Cherry Blossoms (Sakura) have inspired centuries of art and poetry in Japan, symbolizing the fleeting nature of life.

plants.name: Narcissus pseudonarcissus
plants.description: A perennial bulbous plant with trumpet-shaped yellow flowers that emerge early in spring, often found in meadows and woodlands across Europe.
plants.funFact: Wild Daffodils were historically used as a spring indicator and are an important food source for early pollinators.

plants.name: Banksia menziesii
plants.description: An Australian shrub or small tree with distinctive bright orange cylindrical flower spikes that bloom mainly in late summer to early autumn but can extend into early spring in some regions.
plants.funFact: Banksias are a vital nectar source for Australian honeyeaters and other wildlife.

plants.name: Magnolia √ó soulangeana
plants.description: A hybrid magnolia tree with large cup-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple. It typically blooms in early spring, often before its leaves fully develop.
plants.funFact: Saucer Magnolias are hybrids between Magnolia denudata and Magnolia liliiflora, prized for their early showy blossoms.
